data_findings.finding: This is a 2D packing optimization problem: fit Christmas tree toys (15-vertex polygons) into smallest square bounding box for N=1 to 200 trees. Score = sum(side^2/N). Target: 68.919154, best snapshot: 70.659944 (gap: 1.74)

Pre-optimized solutions are at LOCAL OPTIMUM. SA, bbox3, backward propagation all fail to improve. Need CONSTRUCTIVE approaches: greedy backtracking, beam search, or fundamentally different starting configurations.

Key kernels: 1) saspav/santa-submission uses bbox3 C++ optimizer + fix_direction rotation, 2) jazivxt/why-not uses complex number vector coordination + fluid dynamics optimizer, 3) inversion/getting-started shows greedy placement with weighted angles

tree_packer_v21.cpp uses: swap moves, multi-angle restarts, higher temperature SA, squeeze/compaction, local search with 8-directional moves, and backward propagation (removing trees from larger configs to improve smaller ones)

Best 2D irregular polygon packing algorithms: 1) Bottom-left placement + local search, 2) Meta-heuristics (GA, SA, tabu search), 3) DJD-based heuristic, 4) Shelf packing, 5) Jostle moves. Hybrid approaches combining constructive heuristics with meta-heuristics work best.
data_findings.source: Web search: 2D irregular polygon packing algorithms

web_research.query: What are the best algorithms for 2D irregular polygon packing optimization problems?
web_research.finding: The most effective approaches for 2‑D irregular‑polygon packing combine fast constructive heuristics with powerful meta‑heuristics or approximation schemes, depending on problem size and the need for optimality guarantees.  For practical, large‑scale instances the **bottom‑left placement strategy** (often called Bottom‑Left or BL) is a common starting point, and it is extended with **local‑search refinements** (e.g., jostle moves or nonlinear‑programming‑based adjustments) that dramatically improve waste reduction ([Result 3](https://www.taylorfrancis.com/chapters/edit/10.1201/9781351236423-33/practical-algorithms-two-dimensional-packing-general-shapes-yannan-hu-hideki-hashimoto-shinji-imahori-mutsunori-yagiura), [Result 7](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0305054811001596)).  When a higher‑quality solution is required, **meta‑heuristics** such as **genetic algorithms**, **simulated annealing**, **tabu search**, and **artificial neural‑network‑guided searches** ha
